_header: I have been a forester long and many a day
Note:
Cf. 2176; also ‘I have benne a lover’, Dublin, Trinity College, Dublin 160, f. 113; pr. Muir (1961)
XMuir, Kenneth. Unpublished Poems [by] Sir Thomas Wyatt and His Circle.
English Reprints Series 18. Liverpool: Liverpool UP, 1961, 32.
_description: A ‘jolly forester’ song — two cross-rhymed quatrains with internal [middle rhymes with end] rhyme in second and fourth lines

BLAdd5665.First Lines:
Y have ben a foster longe and meney dayMy lokes ben hore foster
                    woll y be no more…
BLAdd5665.Last Lines:
…I shall bygge me a boure atte the wodes endeTher to lede my
                    lyffe att the wodes ende ther to lede my lyffe
